result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Hearing. Bond set 4-29-2022.

BOND TO COVER 22GF1072 & 22CF212

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTORS ERIC GARNER AND ABBEY ROCKTEACHER.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH K.B. dob 3-5-1984. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4873,22-4874

Called at 1:34 PM. Defendant Rebecca L Sobotka in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared for bond purposes. Defendant is eligible for SPD representation. Discussion as to bond. Defendant is on P.O. hold. Court sets total bond with same conditions plus added no contact condition. Dates in 22CF212 remain. Prior bond forfeited. Minutes filed. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Rebecca L. Sobotka in court.  Attorney Keith Venema for Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Rebecca L. Sobotka.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are still negotiating. Trial dates set. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca L. Sobotka not in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Rebecca L. Sobotka.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:34 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on Defense Motion (Denny).  Record by Atty. Lochowicz as to non-appearance of the Defendant. Record by Atty. Herrmann who informs the Court that he is conceding the motion. Further record by Atty. Lochowicz as to speedy demand and will inform the Court tomorrow. 
10:36 a.m. - Defendant appears late. Court takes short recess and will address pre-trial today rather than tomorrow.
10:39 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances and defendant now appears. Atty. Lochowicz informs the Court that she is willing to waive the speedy time limits. Defendant responds to Court's questions. Court finds speedy trial waiver is freely, voluntary, and intelligent and accepts waiver. Court takes off the speedy trial and sets status toward the end of September. Court goes off the record for scheduling.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Rebecca L. Sobotka appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA Sempf.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Rebecca L. Sobotka. Called @ 3:27 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status as to agreement. Record by Atty. Lochowicz who indicates matter did not resolve. Further record as to Denny Motion that he would like to be heard prior to speedy trial set for July. Court sets matter for Denny motion. Speedy trial dates remain as scheduled.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Denny Motion

Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebecca L. Sobotka appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Keith Venema for Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Rebecca L. Sobotka.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:13 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status hearing. Record by Atty. Venema as to offer - asking for status in two weeks. Discussion as to speedy trial demand. Demand was made on May 12, 2022. Trial will have to be set before assigned judge. Atty. Venema requests that a status be set for two (2) weeks at Atty. Lochowicz's request so he can go over the offer with the defendant, who may accept it. Court sets matter for status in two (2) weeks and trial dates will also be set before assigned judge. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Speedy trial demanded by defendant
